posts.content:
Will be up for sale mid September, unless someone makes the right offer

She's a 1958 Australian ckd Kombi, i purchased this two and a half years ago after searching for a small back window with middle brake light and semaphores, an absolute solid bus that had spent most of its life in the hot outback, I will try a and list everything below:

Running gear:
Red9design twin wishbone with race spec calipers fitted brand new only six months a go, cost £3,135.
Type 2 detectives IRS rear end with adjustable spring plates and type 3 drums for better brake coverage and slam shocks, all parts fitted new 12mths ago.
Rebuilt IRS gearbox from t2d.
15inch bus steels with hub caps and all new tyres.
Quick shift gear stick kit. would upgrade to a geneberg if I was keeping.

Engine:
1776 engine running twin ict webers, jmr fly cut heads, balanced crank and lightened flywheel,
Geneberg oil pump full flow with external oil filter and deep sump, new oil cooler and clutch, roller rockers, all new fuel lines.
Vintagespeed tuck away exhaust full system including j tubes only three months old!

Brakes:
All new brake lines and flexi pipes
Dual circuit master cylinder
Vw jim remote servo, 12 months ago
Race spec front four pot calipers
Rear t3 drums with new cylinders and bearing caps etx
New hand brake cables

Electrics:
All new wiring loom
Split charge system with battery under rear seat (not the cheap kit).
New semaphores
Front and rear lights all in good working order
Oil temp and pressure gauges
Standard internal lights
New alternator


Interior:
All new dr cards papered in a retro covering from the 60s
New rock and roll bed
Bit of a mish mash of late split furniture which looks nice and adds to the character (i think)
Devon cupboard with Dudley cooker and heat shield with plate warmer which is very rare
Devon red work top and table with table leg made out o a snooker que
Cushions only covered with a throw at the moment, will req covering.
new headliner ordered and not yet fitted

Exterior:
All in fantastic condition, no rust at all, finished in dove blue
Original front bumper rear is copy
Creative stainless quarter lights and sliders
Rear creative popouts x2
All new window and dr seals.

Chassis:
All solid has had jacking points replaced
All painted with chassis blue rubberised paint from the states.


Bad points:
Paintwork is not show car quality, one or two runs that req rubbing down and polishing.
Front bench seat is a retro fitted rear beetle seat that does the job fine.
One or two dings which I think add to the character of the bus
Has had two pieces of the rear cargo floor removed to fit IRS brackets. 3x3 inch
Interior reqs trimming

All the bad points were on my list to complete but time has beaten me, nothing major.

I'm sure there are a million things I've forgot, all the work above has been done over the last eighteen months.

Price is £29950
Please no messers, I'll post a few pics for now, if you are truly interested I can email more.
Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

[img]http://images.tapatalk-cdn.com/15/08/10/8dbbaa7f82bcde6c61f83931839ccc81[IMG]http://images.tapatalk-cdn.com/15/08/10/6d8855d588cbeb294ad204580a54e08f.jpg[/img] https://vimeo.com/135911844.jpg[/IMG]


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

Sorry a little low, I've sent you a pm, thanks


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
It looks a nice bus mate. But that's all I got. It was werth a go good luck with the sale mate

No worries, I would have done the same , just owes me a bit more than that,



Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

I'll add some of the underside when it stops raining!


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
Still not wot you won't.but I can £25.000

Sorry mate, still can't, I'd be doing myself out of money, you never know it may be for sale for a while so you can get a bit more together, thanks again though


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
Just out of interest, what difference has it made adding the red9design wishbone front end? Is the ride smoother? What the steering like? Looks so nice!

It's a brilliant bit of kit if set up well, you can adjust the ride firmness and height easily enough and the steering is spot on, no wondering along the motorway and can relax with one arm out the window people say you can't fit steals to this kit but with a 9mm spacer and the four pot race spec callipers they clear fine


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
